ZINDEX_MAX

public static final int ZINDEX_MAX
ZINDEX is the location a component on the Z axis (depth) it controls in which order the Component will be painted.
The current component set in the methods getCurrent and setCurrent is always considered the component on zindex=0.
The indexes should be used as follows (this is a recomendation, it is not forced):
-3, -2, -1 : Backgrounds and background animations
0, 1, 2, 3 : Panels, Containers, popup menus and user traversable components in general.
4, 5, 6, 7, ... : Animations, effects, transition animations, mouse pointers, etc.

See Also:
setCurrent(Component), getCurrent(), addComponent(Component, int), Constant Field Values

registerAnimation

public void registerAnimation(Animation anim)
Registers an animation on the internal animation queue. The animatation will remain in the queue until its completed or its removed using the removeAnimation(Animation) method.

Parameters:
anim -
See Also:
Animation

removeAnimation

public void removeAnimation(Animation anim)
Removes the animation from the internal animation queue. Note: If this animation is a top level component it should be removed using the removeComponent instead. This method will remove the animation from the Queue but will not remove it from the FireScreen top level components list.

Parameters:
anim -

showPopupOnComponent

public void showPopupOnComponent(Component popup,
                                 Component cmp,
                                 int zindex)
Utility method to easily display popups that should be located near the component that triggered them. For example when opening a drop-down menu, it should be opened near the menu component that triggered it. This method provides an easy way to open the popup, without the need to calculate its position (x,y). It takes into acount the location of the trigger component and the orientation of the screen.

Parameters:
popup - The popup component to display
cmp - The component that is the logical trigger for this popup to apear
zindex - The zindex on which the popup will be added using the Displayable.addCommand(Command) method.

showPopupOnLeftSoftkey

public void showPopupOnLeftSoftkey(Component popup,
                                   int zindex)
Utility method to open a popup on the left softkey. It is equivalent to: FireScreen.getScreen().showPopupOnComponent(popup,FireScreen.getScreen().getComponent(FireScreen.LEFT_SOFTKEY_ZINDEX),zindex)

Parameters:
popup -
zindex -
See Also:
showPopupOnComponent(Component, Component, int)

showAlert

public int showAlert(java.lang.String message,
                     byte type,
                     byte defaultSelection,
                     javax.microedition.lcdui.Command command,
                     CommandListener listener)
Utility method for fast and easy user notification. Creates an alert with the given parameters and displayes it on the screen using zindex (see ZINDEX_MAX 4

Parameters:
message - The message to be shown in the alert
type - The type of the alert
defaultSelection - The default button selected.
command - The command to be send to the listener when the user presses a button on the alert.
listener - The listener to receive the command when the user presses a button on the alert.
See Also:
Alert

setOrientation

public void setOrientation(int orientation)
Sets the orientation of the FireScreen to the given value. This method will cause all components to be validated and redrawn on the new orientation.

Parameters:
orientation -
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if orientation is no FireScreen.NORMAL, FireScreen.LANDSCAPELEFT or FireScreen.LANDSCAPERIGHT

repaintScreen

public void repaintScreen(int cx,
                          int cy,
                          int cwidth,
                          int cheight)
Repaints a part of the FireScreen canvas. The coordinates are in reference to the FireScreen coordinates and not to the real screen. That means that in landscape modes the correct part of the screen will be redrawn.

Parameters:
cx -
cy -
cwidth -
cheight -

destroy

public void destroy()
Causes this FireScreen instance to be destroyed. Stopping the animation handler. This method should be called during the middlet clean-up stage.
Note: The method will cause the animation handler to die but may return before the thread is dead.

isAnimationsEnabled

public boolean isAnimationsEnabled()
Returns:
See Also:
setAnimationsEnabled(boolean)

setAnimationsEnabled

public void setAnimationsEnabled(boolean animationsEnabled)
On lower-end devices with less CPU and memory available it is often good practice not to show animations that may consume resources needed for more usefull operations. When this flag is set the FireScreen and all Fire components that have animations associated with them (i.e. Panel scroll, softkey animations etc) will not display animations.

Parameters:
animationsEnabled -

getScreenshot

public javax.microedition.lcdui.Image getScreenshot(boolean withSoftkeys)
Creates an image with the contents of the FireScreen. This method is usefull to get snapshots of the screen to use with animations or store them in files. This method will create a new image with the dimensions of the screen and will render the FireScreen contents inside it.

Parameters:
withSoftkeys - If false, the screenshot will not contain the softkeys. @see isPaintSoftkeys
Returns:
